actions.recommendation: PSA testing annually from age 40 if one first-degree relative who had prostate cancer at <65yrs or female relatives diagnosed with BRCA1 or BRCA2 gene mutation breast cancer. From age 45: if history of prostate cancer on either the mother or father’s side.From age 50: every 2 years

PSA testing annually from age 40 if one first-degree relative who had prostate cancer at <65yrs or female relatives diagnosed with BRCA1 or BRCA2 gene mutation breast cancer. From age 45: if history of prostate cancer on either the mother or father’s side.From age 50: every 2 years

Optimise diet to reduce cholesterol, take omega 3 supplements 2g daily and coQ10 supplement, use extra-virgin olive oil for raw and low-temperature uses. For high-temperature cooking, avocado oil, coconut oil or ghee
